bug.author: ikeaney
bug.description:
Be sure you've searched <denchmark-link:https://forums.fast.ai>the forums</denchmark-link> for the error message you received. Also, unless you're an experienced fastai developer, first ask on the forums to see if someone else has seen a similar issue already and knows how to solve it. Please see this model example of how to fill out an issue correctly. Please try to emulate that example as appropriate when opening an issue. Please confirm you have the latest versions of fastai, fastcore, fastscript, and nbdev prior to reporting a bug (delete one): YES /
When I call doc(show_images) and click on the link the URL returned is broken (<denchmark-link:https://docs.fast.ai/torch.core#show_images>https://docs.fast.ai/torch.core#show_images</denchmark-link> ) To Reproduce Expected behavior Error with full stack trace Place between these lines with triple backticks: <denchmark-code></denchmark-code>
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: I think this is the same as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fastai/fastai/issues/2872>#2872</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/marii-moe>@marii-moe</denchmark-link> where are you finding this link? I'm seeing this link <denchmark-link:https://docs.fast.ai/torch_core#show_images>https://docs.fast.ai/torch_core#show_images</denchmark-link> show properly.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu>@hamelsmu</denchmark-link> can reproduce: !pip install fastai --upgrade !pip install nbdev
from fastai.vision.all import * doc(show_images) Clicking the url points to <denchmark-link:https://docs.fast.ai/torch.core#show_images>https://docs.fast.ai/torch.core#show_images</denchmark-link>
Same with anything in torch_core I think, as show_image did it too.
